lines.text: The moment I saw you I knew...
I bet you say that to all your wives.
I came here with my wife... hum... my bride really. Now my wife, not my bride... my wife... Why should I bore you with details?
I won't be bored.
Listen, it's just simple as A B C.
Don't tell me you got someone in B?
Something's come up. My wife.
Who are you?
Well, your honor...
Oh, he was on the island with her. He's not important to this case.
I'll decide what's important to the case. What island?
The island where my wife stayed for seven years, your honor.
They were on an island together for seven years?
Yes, your honor.
Not alone?
Yes.
Hmm. Same island?
Yes.
Is that in the brief?
No, your honor!
Oh, that should be in the brief. That's the most interesting part of the case.
Oh, by the way, how was my funeral?
Lovely. Doctor Blake preached a wonderful service.
Oh, I wish I had been there.
Impulsive? He's full of carrots!
Oh, you Casanova, you.
[Ellen speaking with her children, whom she hasn't seen since they were babies]
Are you a lady or a man?
Well, I used to be a lady...
Are ya a sailor?
A lady sailor?
Well...
My mother was practically a sailor - she went down in a shipwreck.
Oh, he's always boasting.

[discussing how to tell Tim and Chinch that Ellen is their mother]
Would it help if I wrote them a letter?
Oh, that would be nice, yes. 'Enclosed, please find your mother.'
[Dr. Kohlmar walks in on Nick holding a dress in front of himself with a lady's hat on his head]
Do you think this goes together? Blue ought to go with blue, right?
Yes, I suppose.
It's for a friend.
I'd like to get home and tell my wife about this. She thinks all my cases are boring.
Do you ride in cabs or do you just trot alongside?
